dialog: My dad`s been saying that to me since I was fifteen.
Because nice Greek girls are supposed to do three things in life: marry Greek boys, make Greek babies and feed everyone...
When I was growing up, I knew I was different.
The other girls were blonde and delicate.
And I was a swarthy 6 yearold with sideburns.
I so badly wanted to be like the popular girls...
The pretty girls went to Brownie`s.
I had to go to Greek school.
At Greek school, I learned valuable lessons like: ``If Nick has one goat, and Maria has nine, how soon will they marry?
My mom was always cooking foods filled with warmth and wisdom.
And never forgetting that side dish of steaming hot guilt.
Niko, don`t play with the food!
At your age, we didn`t have food.
Why do l have to go to Greek school?
When you get married, don`t you want to write your motherinlaw?
We lived in a normal middleclass Chicago neighborhood...
Our house, however, was modeled after the Parthenon...
complete with Corinthian columns and guarded by statues of the gods.
In case the neighbors had any doubts about our heritage...
they could just check out our subtle tribute to the Greek flag.
My dad believed in only two things: that Greeks should educate nonGreeks about being Greek...
and that any illment, from psoriasis to poisonivy...
Six years later: I was 1 2, Athena, my older perfect sister, was 1 5...
and my brother Nick was 1 1. Every morning, my dad would lecture us...
on the history of our people, the great civilization: the Greeks.
Now, name three things the Greeks did first.
any word, and l`ll show you how the root of that word is Greek.
``Arachna``, that comes from the Greek word for ``spider``...
and ``phobia`` means ``fear``, so fear of spider. There you go.
Of course! ``Kimono`` comes from the Greek word ``cheimonas``...
So, what do you wear in the winter time to stay warm? A robe.
You should be proud to be Greek.
Years went by, and dad brought his mother from Greece to live with us...
Get her! Where is she going?
The Greeks and the Turks are friends now!
We told my grandma that war was over, but she still slept with a knife.
She has a very mean punch!
Nice Greek girls who don`t find a husband work in the family restaurant.
So, here I am, day after day, year after year...
thirty, and way passed my expiration date.
Fortoula! You closed last night, you`re opening this morning.
Ah, Toula, you talk to me sometime, uh?
Ma, you`re going to make me swallow my tongue.
She was supposed to come over to curl my hair.
Nick, did you check the meat before you signed for it?
My brother has 2 jobs: to cook and to marry a Greek virgin.
Voula, have something to eat before you go to work.
If nagging was an Olympic sport, my aunt Voula would have a gold medal.
Taki. You couldn`t wait for me?
Last night, my toe was as big as my face.
So why didn`t you wait for me?
Anyway, l tell her l will send her to Greece...
Say, is she not too old?
...don`t tell anyone how old she is.
lt`s like she doesn`t want to marry.
Come on, we`re going to see uncle Nick.
My sister married young and became a Greek baby breeding machine.
Quick coffee. l`ll drop the boys off at hockey and then go to the Jewel.

Can you believe it? l`m out of honey. Put that back for me.

because some jagoff and his bigass girlfriend are too busy.
l open the drycleaners every day.
lt`s about time she did something.

l`ll get you pantyhose at Jewel.
You drive me crazy. Let`s go!

I wish I was braver and prettier...
You missed a hell of a party the other night.

You set me up with her already.
Well, maybe. So, do you want me to set you up?
Have you ever had one of those days?
Going along and then stops. Here l am, your private Greek statue.
Can l get some more coffee, please?

l know. l`ve got a class, though.
l loved this spice. What is that?

Do you like this? For the new menu?

and l`ve noticed that we`ve been doing a lot of unnecessary ordering.
Maybe we should update our system.
Like, we could get a computer.
l don`t know if you remember, but l got all A`s in Computers.
But there`s a lot of new stuff to learn now, so, if you want...
l could go to college and take a few courses.
Why do you want to leave me?
l`m not leaving you. Don`t you want me to do something with my life?
l know what you want. You have, how do you say? You have a spirit.
You want to see things, you want to learn.
l know. You`re from my side.
l`m going to talk to him.
Dad is stubborn. What he says goes.
``The man is the head of the house``.
Let me tell you something, Toula: the man is the head...
but the woman is the neck. She can turn the head anywhere she wants.
Don`t cry, don`t cry, come on.

That Toula will get involved with drugs?
No, but somebody will say to her: ``Take this bag down to the bus depot``, and she`ll do it!

She`s smart enough for a girl.
You think you`re smarter than me, uh?
l run the restaurant, l cook, l clean, l wash for you...
and l raised three kids, and l teach Sunday school, you know?
lt`s lucky for me l have you to tie my shoes!
Excuse me, is this seat taken?

l don`t like it, but Taki likes it.
Listen, l`m not going to pretend...
this is something l`ve always wanted to do. l`m just saying it`s different.

with all the latest applications and programs. l could apply it here.
You could take a vacation. l could book it for you. Would you hire me?
l`m sorry. Oh, my God, ma!
We must let Costa think this was his idea. That he came up with it.

But don`t tell me what to say.

because everybody else is working at the big drycleaning store.

and now l have no time with him.

and you`ll be with Taki at the drycleaner.

l don`t remember frump girl, but l remember you.

Okay. Christmas. What do you do for Christmas with your family?

trying to get me to eat it, because it`s going to make me smart.
You have 2 cousins. l have 27 first cousins, just 27 first cousins alone.
My whole family is big and loud...
and everybody`s in each other`s lives and business all the time.
You never have a minute alone to think. We`re always together, eating.
All the other people we know are Greeks. Greeks marry Greeks...
to breed more Greeks, to be loud breeding Greek eaters.
No one in my family has ever gone out with a nonGreek before. No one.
But l just don`t see how this is going to work out, so...
Yes, we come from different backgrounds and...
Hey, here`s some news about my life to this point: it`s boring.
Then l met you, and you`re interesting, beautiful and fun.
l just want to spend some time with you.
l just want to spend a little time with you.
This is good. Could you stop?
Right here is good. Just stop.

Hey, Niko, where did you go?

lan, this is my cousin Nikki.

l`m the least of your worries.
